result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay. Provide DNA sample.

*NO driving without a valid driver's license, comply with any restrictions.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah Dixon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremiah Dixon in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO SENTENCING 
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, 9 certificates.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 5 DAYS time served, with full Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-No driving without a valid driver's license, comply with any restrictions.
-Obtain/maintain employment, school or combination of both.
-No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, paid from bail on deposit, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed:  missed telephone contact on 7-24-2015.   Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 8-10-2015.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: missed office visit on 05-29-2015. 
Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next scheduled court date.

Defendant Jeremiah Dixon in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Jeremiah Dixon in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Jeremiah Dixon in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge, Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
